newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks in London down on nervous trading.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks in London down on nervous trading.

text.p: Hong Kong stocks in London closed lower in nervous trading on Friday, after they shadowed an early fall and then an afternoon rally in the main international markets, traders said.
The Hang Seng London Reference index fell 61.75 points to 12,722.32, after the Hang Seng index in Hong Kong tumbled 269.21 points to 12,784.07.
"Shares were weaker in the morning as futures closed at a discount in Hong Kong," said one trader. "Then there was a tiny bit of a rebound when Wall Street and U.S. bonds rallied," he added.
Another trader said: "There has not been a whole lot of business, so it has been a bit volatile. Everyone is very nervous."
The markets have been jittery since U.S. Federal Reserve Chairman Alan Greenspan's anti-inflation comments knocked the wind out of market optimism on last week's "grey Friday."
